concept.title: Material Conditions
concept.shortdesc: The second compartment displays tolerance values. Depending on control type, you can add a diameter symbol prior to the tolerance value, and specify a material condition symbol behind this value.

conbody.p: You can apply material conditions to features that can vary in size, shown as follows:

ul.li: At maximum material condition (symbol M, also known as MMC), a feature contains the maximum amount of material stated in the limits. At MMC, a hole has a minimum diameter, whereas a shaft has a maximum diameter.

At least material condition (symbol L, also known as LMC), a feature contains the minimum amount of material stated in the limits. At LMC, a hole has a maximum diameter, whereas a shaft has minimum diameter.

conbody.p: Regardless of feature size (symbol S, also known as RFS) means a feature can be any size within the stated limits.
